docs.abstract: She writes that Congress will continue to reject the president’s effort to defund public broadcasting. Also: Neo-Nazi books; sex crimes and trauma; transgender youth; night owls.
docs.snippet: She writes that Congress will continue to reject the president’s effort to defund public broadcasting. Also: Neo-Nazi books; sex crimes and trauma; transgender youth; night owls.

headline.main: From Rep. Nita Lowey: Trump vs. NPR

docs.abstract: In a first, videos outnumbered photos in reports to the authorities last year. Facebook found the most imagery, the bulk of it on its Messenger app.
docs.snippet: In a first, videos outnumbered photos in reports to the authorities last year. Facebook found the most imagery, the bulk of it on its Messenger app.
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of reported photos, videos and other materials related to online child sexual abuse grew by more than 50 percent last year, an indication that many of the world’s biggest technology platforms remain infested with the illegal content.

headline.main: Tech Companies Detect a Surge in Online Videos of Child Sexual Abuse
headline.print_headline: Reports of Online Videos of Child Sexual Abuse Climb by Millions

docs.abstract: Amazon’s popular Ring security cameras have gaping security holes. Here’s how to protect yourself.

docs.lead_paragraph: Has there ever been a tech product more polarizing than Ring?

headline.main: Your Doorbell Camera Spied on You. Now What?
headline.print_headline: Keeping the Eye in Your Door From Spying on You

docs.abstract: The European Union outlined proposals to bolster its digital economy and keep it from being overly reliant on foreign companies, while cracking down on those companies.
docs.snippet: The European Union outlined proposals to bolster its digital economy and keep it from being overly reliant on foreign companies, while cracking down on those companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Across the digital economy, Europe has been missing.

headline.main: Europe, Overrun by Foreign Tech Giants, Wants to Grow Its Own
headline.print_headline: Europe Seeks to Plant Its Own Tech Cash Crop

byline.original: By Adam Satariano and Monika Pronczuk

docs.abstract: The world’s richest man unveiled a fund to help climate scientists and activists, an escalation of his philanthropic efforts.
docs.snippet: The world’s richest man unveiled a fund to help climate scientists and activists, an escalation of his philanthropic efforts.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Jeff Bezos, Amazon’s chief executive and the world’s richest man, said on Monday that he was committing $10 billion to address the climate crisis in a new initiative he called the Bezos Earth Fund.

headline.main: Jeff Bezos Commits $10 Billion to Address Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Bezos Pledges $10 Billion Fund To Address Climate Change

docs.abstract: And is President Trump actually good for the Republican Party?
docs.snippet: And is President Trump actually good for the Republican Party?
docs.lead_paragraph: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:

docs.abstract: Just a year ago, the world’s richest man seemed to have a pretty low-key life. Times sure have changed.
docs.snippet: Just a year ago, the world’s richest man seemed to have a pretty low-key life. Times sure have changed.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When Jeff Bezos and his former wife, MacKenzie, celebrated what would be their last anniversary together around Labor Day 2018, they arrived at a Miami nightclub with no fanfare. His table was booked online, which is “totally what tourists do” and “totally dorky,” the club’s celebrity liaison said in an interview at the time.

headline.print_headline: Hot Love! Tabloids Embrace New Bezos

docs.abstract: U.N. experts lent their weight to allegations that Saudi Arabia’s crown prince hacked the cellphone of Jeff Bezos, owner of The Washington Post, to “influence, if not silence,” its reporting.
docs.snippet: U.N. experts lent their weight to allegations that Saudi Arabia’s crown prince hacked the cellphone of Jeff Bezos, owner of The Washington Post, to “influence, if not silence,” its reporting.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — United Nations experts broadened the inquiry into Saudi Arabia’s efforts to squelch criticism on Wednesday, accusing its crown prince of personally hacking the cellphone of Jeff Bezos, the billionaire owner of The Washington Post, to “influence, if not silence” the newspaper’s critical coverage of the kingdom.

headline.main: Bezos Phone Hack Tied to Saudi Crown Prince Puts New Pressure on Kingdom
headline.print_headline: Crown Prince’s Motive? To Mute Criticism by The Post, U.N. Experts Suggest

byline.original: By Ben Hubbard and Michael Schwirtz

docs.abstract: The Amazon founder’s investigation did not find evidence to back his suggestion of a link between Saudi Arabia and the tabloid that gleefully exposed his affair.
docs.snippet: The Amazon founder’s investigation did not find evidence to back his suggestion of a link between Saudi Arabia and the tabloid that gleefully exposed his affair.
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost a year ago, Jeff Bezos hinted that Saudi Arabia had played a role in The National Enquirer’s 11-page exposé of his affair with the Los Angeles television personality Lauren Sanchez. In making the case in a post on the website Medium, Mr. Bezos noted that his newspaper, The Washington Post, had published the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi and had also covered the kingdom’s suspected role in his murder.

headline.main: Jeff Bezos’ Hack Inquiry Falls Short of Implicating National Enquirer
headline.print_headline: Hot Love! Tabloids Embrace New Bezos

byline.original: By Jim Rutenberg and Michael Rothfeld

docs.abstract: Trustbusting advocates like Sarah Miller, who target corporate power, have finally found themselves at the center of the political conversation.
docs.snippet: Trustbusting advocates like Sarah Miller, who target corporate power, have finally found themselves at the center of the political conversation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One night five years ago, Sarah Miller, a former Treasury Department aide, was trying to make sense of an economic recovery that had left the country in the grips of rising inequality.

headline.main: She Wants to Break Up Big Everything
headline.print_headline: She Wants To Break Up  Big Everything
